Dear Mayor Adams,
My name is , and I am a constituent who currently lives in . I am writing to express concern about the lack of awareness regarding health code violations among diners in New York City. As one of the culinary capitals of the world, our city attracts food lovers from across the globe. It’s essential that we uphold our reputation by ensuring diners have easy access to information about recent health code violations and the health grade of restaurants before they dine out. This transparency will help maintain trust in the quality and safety of the dining experiences our city offers.
The NYC Health Department has a website linked below that allows you to look up all restaurant health grades.
Link: NYC Health Department Website
The table below outlines the health grades and their corresponding point ranges. Additionally, I have included images of the posters that restaurants are required to display in their windows.



Letter Grade
Numeric Score




A
0-13 points


B
14-27 points


C
28+ points




I propose that the Mayor’s Office, promote the map below that allows a patron to look up specific violations or citations by neighborhood or establishment name.


Moving forward, the Mayors office should use any of the following strategies to raise awareness:

Raise awareness about what each health grade means.
Create a social media and marketing campaign to raise awareness on where to get this information.
Release a list of the worst health code violations for diners to watch out for.
Have a website that allows you to look up health code violations or citations by restaurant or neighborhood, like the map above.

Below, I’ve provided an example of positive press coverage regarding the expansion of the health grading system to include food carts in the city.


Thank you for your consideration.
Sincerely,

title: About the Author
text:
My name is Caroline Maramara and I am a graduate student in the Geoinformatics program at Hunter College. This is my first website and I have made it for a class called WebGIS.
As an avid New York City diner, I have often found myself arriving at a restaurant, only to find that they have a B rating. I have often had the conversation with my friends about how it would be great to have a place to check restaurant health ratings as well as violations and citations issued to the establishment.
I hope this website helps bring the information to the masses and helps you become a more informed eater.
